Uses of Class
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCardList

    • Uses of TCardList in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

      Methods in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib that return TCardList 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      TCardList TGame.getCards()
      Return the card list object containing all the cards participating to the game.
      TCardList TGame.getTabellone()
      Return a list of card object containing the six "special" cards forming the tombola billboard associated to this game.
      static TCardList TBillboardCard.getWholeBillboard​(String label)
      Return a list of new cards containing the six "special cards" that compose the classical tombola billboard. You can add this list of TBillboardCard objects to a TCardList list object using the standard addAll() method, so that even billboard cards can can participate to a tombola game, just like any other normal card, eventually be awarded of prizes, etc.
      Methods in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib with parameters of type TCardList 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean TCardList.addCardList​(TCardList otherCards)
      Add to this TCardList all cards contained in the TCardList passed as argument. For example, you can use this method to add billboard cards before pass the list to a TGame object, letting also billboard cards to participate to awards assignment process.
      boolean TCardList.removeCardList​(TCardList otherCards)
      Helper method that let you remove a whole subset of cards from this TCardList collection.
      void TGame.setCards​(TCardList cards)
      Set the list containing all the cards that will be used during the tombola game. TCardList objects can be prepared starting from TSeriesList objects, that are usually used to store and load series of cards to and from files.
      void TGame.setTabellone​(TCardList tabellone)
      Associate to this TGame instance the six special cards forming the tombola billboard (i.e. the 'tabellone'). They to not participate to award assignment, unless they are included in the TCardList object passed using the TGame.setCards(TCardList) method, but are equally updated at each extraction, so they can be used to display the game status.
